intro: Brunfelsia brasiliensis subsp. macrocalyx, commonly known as the Brazilian nightshade, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its striking, tubular, violet-blue flowers that bloom at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The plant has dark green, glossy leaves and produces attractive, berry-like fruits that are edible for humans but toxic to livestock. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant. Its botanical features make it a unique and visually appealing addition to tropical gardens.
